results.title: The Children's fountain
results.creator_credit: George Zabriskie, U.S. Committee for UNICEF and United Nations
results.brief_description: Shows the programs of the Turkish Government to improve the health and welfare of their children. These programs are aided by UNICEF and other UN agencies. They are seen through the eyes of a young nurse, who takes additional special training and becomes part of a pilot project for rural nursing.

results.title: The Children
results.creator_credit: Department of Public Information of the United Nations
results.brief_description: This film describes the work of the United Nations International Children’s Emergency Fund. It shows how the drive for increased food production, the health programs and the educational activities of UNICEF are being carried out in many areas to provide a more hopeful world for tomorrow’s citizens.

results.title: The Child watchers
results.creator_credit: Jean Oser, L. Richard Ellison, National Educational Television and Time-Life Broadcast
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World We Live In”.
The reflexes of a newborn baby are the basis for early learning, this is shown to be more extensive than was once thought. Experiments by developmental psychologists such as Piaget and Brunner are demonstrated with children up to the age of 6. Based on the book “The Mind” by John Rowan Wilson - a volume in the Life Science Library. Narrated by Luis Van Rooten. Suggested audience: senior secondary, tertiary, general.

results.title: The Child molester
results.creator_credit: Herbert J. Leder and HSF Safety and Training
results.brief_description: Emphasises the dangers of attack on children and dramatizes typical approaches. The film shows what can be done to reduce the problem by making children aware of molesters and the precautions to be taken when accosted by strangers.

results.title: The Charter of the United Nations
results.creator_credit: Alexander Shaw and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: An explanation of the structure and the purposes of the United Nations Organization, showing the General Assembly, the Security Council, and the various commissions set up to further the cause of world peace and well-being. Commentary by Francis Williams.

results.title: The Charter
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Office of Public Information
results.brief_description: The Charter and the main organs of the United Nations. Traces the historical background to the Charter, the broad principles laid down in its preamble and shows scenes of the meeting at which it was signed. Describes the membership and functions of the General Assembly, the Security Council, the Economic and Social Council, the Trusteeship Council, the International Court of Justice and the United Nations Secretariat. Beautifully photographed and interspersed with newsreels and stock footage of both world wars. Compiled by V.R. Sarma; commentary by Alistair Cooke and Michael Allinson.

results.title: The Charm of Ulster
results.brief_description: Tours the six Northern Ireland counties. Explores the strange rock formations of the Giant’s Causeway, the walled city and port of Londonderry, and the great port and shipbuilding centre of Belfast. Shows the golf and motor racing for which Ulster is famous; also visits St Patrick’s tomb at Downpatrick, and the romantic town of Enniskillen.

results.title: The Chaparral prince
results.creator_credit: Mark Cullingham, Elaine Sperber and Highgate Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on a short story by O Henry, it tells the story of frail young Lena, who is hired out by her father to a wicked innkeeper. Lena finds escape in a book of fairy tales about handsome princes who save maidens in distress. When the innkeeper throws the book on the fire, a chain of events is started which proves to Lena that fairy tales can come true. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Changing world of Charles Dickens
results.creator_credit: John irvin, Jonathan Hansen, Allan King and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Recreates scenes from “David Copperfield”, “Oliver Twist”, “Dombey and Son”, “Great Expectations” and “Hard Times” in order to illustrate how Dickens not only reflected the harshness of his times but sought to change the social inequities as well. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Changing Middle East
results.creator_credit: Sam Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Discusses the history of the Middle East. Contrasts old ways with the new in agriculture, industry etc. in emphasizing the changing image of this part of the world.
